arts.ttl: Viktor Gyökeres hat-trick fires Sporting to 3-1 win over Moreirense
arts.sum: Sporting took a step forward in their quest to retain the Portuguese title with a convincing 3-1 victory over Moreirense at Alvalade tonight. The usual suspect Viktor Gyökeres was the star of the show, netting a hat-trick to bring his season tally to 34 goals in 29 Primeira Liga games, which is more than double his closest challengers in the scoring charts Samu Aghehowa and Vangelis Pavlidis. A vibrant start by the Lions was rewarded when the Swede poked home from close range in the 12th minute and the striker soon doubled Sporting’s lead with a powerful angled shot from inside the box. Gyökeres completed his hat-trick early in the second half with a thunderous free kick and only wasteful finishing by Geny Catamo and Francisco Trincão prevented it from getting embarrassing for the visitors. Moreirense pulled a goal back when Cédric Teguia headed in an outstanding cross from Godfried Frimpong and the visitors improved in the final half hour, but the result was never in doubt. Sporting go three points clear of title rivals Benfica, putting pressure on the Eagles ahead of their tricky trip to Guimarães to face Vitória tomorrow. arts.ttl: Arsenal receive Gyokeres update as HIJACK takes place
arts.sum: Friday 18 April saw several major transfer updates drop, including the latest on Viktor Gyokeres and Martin Zubimendi. Arsenal receive Gyokeres update as HIJACK takes place

arts.ttl: Chelsea HIJACK Arsenal transfer plans by repeating Quenda trick for Gyokeres
arts.sum: Gyokeres is believed to prefer to join a top Premier League side like Arsenal or Liverpool but the 27-year-old is also thought to be open to a move to Stamford Bridge, putting the Gunners on alert if Chelsea do make a strong pursuit for the Swedish hot-shot. With Chelsea, Arsenal, Manchester United and Liverpool all set to be in the market for a striker this summer, prolific marksmen like Gyokeres will undoubtedly find themselves the attention of multiple clubs.
